channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dogs mess, 14th August
item.description:
Someone is consistently letting their dog mess on a narrow path between the Cameron house bungalows and the nursery. This is causing misery for neighbours with wheelchairs and push chairs as it is impossible to avoid travelling through it. I keep seeing that the problem has been fixed, but it has not no one has been out. I noticed someone has brushed some of the piles to the side of the path but they are still there. ///topped.pizza.rush

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cornford Close, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Thorny shrub overhanging wall, 14th August
item.description:
My daughter is blind and had to walk using her cane along this road and is constantly battling with overhanging hedges, trees and shrubs. She walked into this particular one which is very thorny and injured herself walking into it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eardley Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent unsanitary dog fouling on path, 14th August
item.description:
This issue is repeatedly reported. Please escalate this to somebody that can resolve the problem. There are dog fouls on nearly every paving stone of the path

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Cameron Road, Hayes, London

item.title: Black construction material dust flying to bedroom constantly, triggering lung pain and asthma, more severe daily, have asked construction to clean but still constant dark particles coming in, 14th August
item.description:
There is a delayed construction site next to my bedroom and WFH office. Black building dust flying to my acommodation constantly despite telling site staff, causing severe respiratory health issues and health fears: pain in my lungs and waiting for GP.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Berger Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lampost Equipment/peices removed left on pavement and spilling into the road., 14th August
item.description:
The large white bag initially had electrical equipment or peices below the lamppost which I presume by the looks of it were removed from the lamppost. The bag has remained here and not disposed of correctly and has now become a spot for people to throw their litter/rubbish into it. Please can you kindly remove this as soon as possible as it is overfilled, ripping and falling into the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tellson Avenue, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Missing litter bin, 14th August
item.description:
The litter bin at the Victoria Way end of Wellington Gardens disappeared a good month or more ago. May we have our bin back please? Some of us clear street litter ourselves and have always put it in the public bin (where it should have been in the first place). Now we have to put it in our own bins thus reducing our own space. This is unfair given that we are doing a job which should be done by the council.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Gardens, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pytchley Road, East Dulwich, London

item.title: TL2161617 - 10/723 foliage blocking drivers view of sign, 14th August
item.description:
Hi on passing noticed foliage growing infront of and behind the OVD sign. All needs cutting back to behind the wall. Foliage is climbing plants from railway land. Please report foliage to road authority (red route road). Regards John

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Latchmere Road, Clapham Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet
